trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Modules
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Modules

trans-unit.source: The typical workflow for machine learning includes many phases: identifying a problem to solve, finding appropriate data, and preparing data or modeling identifying or engineering features.
trans-unit.target: The typical workflow for machine learning includes many phases: identifying a problem to solve, finding appropriate data, and preparing data or modeling identifying or engineering features.

trans-unit.source: For a detailed description of the experimental workflow, see the <externalLink><linkText>credit risk solution walkthrough</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/machine-learning-walkthrough-develop-predictive-solution/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For a detailed description of the experimental workflow, see the <externalLink><linkText>credit risk solution walkthrough</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/machine-learning-walkthrough-develop-predictive-solution/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The modules in this section provide tools for the final phases of machine learning, in which you apply an algorithm to data, generate some scores, and then evaluate whether the model is fairly accurate in its predictions or if you must tune and tweak the model some more.
trans-unit.target: The modules in this section provide tools for the final phases of machine learning, in which you apply an algorithm to data, generate some scores, and then evaluate whether the model is fairly accurate in its predictions or if you must tune and tweak the model some more.

trans-unit.source: Categories
trans-unit.target: Categories

trans-unit.source: This section (Modules References.Machine Learning) includes the following categories of module used for machine learning: modules for configuring the basic learners, modules for training all model types, and models for scoring data and evaluating models.
trans-unit.target: This section (Modules References.Machine Learning) includes the following categories of module used for machine learning: modules for configuring the basic learners, modules for training all model types, and models for scoring data and evaluating models.

trans-unit.source: Additional Resources
trans-unit.target: Additional Resources

trans-unit.source: For examples of machine learning in action, see the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/machine-learning/models/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For examples of machine learning in action, see the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/machine-learning/models/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Data Exploration and Data Quality
trans-unit.target: Data Exploration and Data Quality

trans-unit.source: Part of the machine learning process is making sure your data is the right kind of data, the right quantity, and the right quality for the algorithm you’ve chosen.
trans-unit.target: Part of the machine learning process is making sure your data is the right kind of data, the right quantity, and the right quality for the algorithm you’ve chosen.

trans-unit.source: Understand how much data you have, how it is distributed.
trans-unit.target: Understand how much data you have, how it is distributed.

trans-unit.source: Are there outliers?
trans-unit.target: Are there outliers?

trans-unit.source: How were those generated and what do they mean?
trans-unit.target: How were those generated and what do they mean?

trans-unit.source: Are there any duplicate records?
trans-unit.target: Are there any duplicate records?

trans-unit.source: For examples, see <externalLink><linkText>Advanced data processing in Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/machine-learning-data-science-advanced-data-processing/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For examples, see <externalLink><linkText>Advanced data processing in Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/machine-learning-data-science-advanced-data-processing/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Missing Value Handling
trans-unit.target: Missing Value Handling

trans-unit.source: Missing values can affect your results in many ways.
trans-unit.target: Missing values can affect your results in many ways.

trans-unit.source: For example, almost all statistical methods discard cases with missing values.
trans-unit.target: For example, almost all statistical methods discard cases with missing values.

trans-unit.source: If you want to impute the missing values or correct your data, use <link xlink:href="d2c5ca2f-7323-41a3-9b7e-da917c99f0c4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Clean Missing Values</link> before training your model.
trans-unit.target: If you want to impute the missing values or correct your data, use <link xlink:href="d2c5ca2f-7323-41a3-9b7e-da917c99f0c4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Clean Missing Values</link> before training your model.

trans-unit.source: By default, Azure Machine Learning follows these rules when it encounters rows with missing values:
trans-unit.target: By default, Azure Machine Learning follows these rules when it encounters rows with missing values:

trans-unit.source: If data used to train a model has missing values, any rows with missing values are skipped.
trans-unit.target: If data used to train a model has missing values, any rows with missing values are skipped.

trans-unit.source: If data used as input when scoring against a model has missing values, the missing values are used as inputs, but nulls are propagated, which usually means that the result is also a missing value.
trans-unit.target: If data used as input when scoring against a model has missing values, the missing values are used as inputs, but nulls are propagated, which usually means that the result is also a missing value.

trans-unit.source: Feature Selection and Dimensionality Reduction
trans-unit.target: Feature Selection and Dimensionality Reduction

trans-unit.source: Use tools such as <link xlink:href="dcaab0b2-59ca-4bec-bb66-79fd23540080" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Fisher LDA</link> or <link xlink:href="818b356b-045c-412b-aa12-94a1d2dad90f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Filter Based Feature Selection</link> to determine which columns of data have the most predictive power.
trans-unit.target: Use tools such as <link xlink:href="dcaab0b2-59ca-4bec-bb66-79fd23540080" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Fisher LDA</link> or <link xlink:href="818b356b-045c-412b-aa12-94a1d2dad90f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Filter Based Feature Selection</link> to determine which columns of data have the most predictive power.

trans-unit.source: Find out if any columns should be removed because of <newTerm>data leakage</newTerm>.
trans-unit.target: Find out if any columns should be removed because of <newTerm>data leakage</newTerm>.

trans-unit.source: Create or engineer features from existing data.
trans-unit.target: Create or engineer features from existing data.

trans-unit.source: Reduce dimensionality by <legacyLink xlink:href="cd734326-1fc7-480f-b5f6-2e9a50694c96" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">grouping categorical values</legacyLink>, by using <link xlink:href="8be18eb5-ddd8-4d12-8573-7ae10d5f72fb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">PCA</link>, or by <legacyLink xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">sampling</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: Reduce dimensionality by <legacyLink xlink:href="cd734326-1fc7-480f-b5f6-2e9a50694c96" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">grouping categorical values</legacyLink>, by using <link xlink:href="8be18eb5-ddd8-4d12-8573-7ae10d5f72fb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">PCA</link>, or by <legacyLink xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">sampling</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you might need to use <link xlink:href="986df333-6748-4b85-923d-871df70d6aaf" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">normalize data</link> or <link xlink:href="61dd433a-ee80-4ac3-87f0-b54708644d93" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">bin data</link> to bin data or adjust the range of values prior to analysis.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you might need to use <link xlink:href="986df333-6748-4b85-923d-871df70d6aaf" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">normalize data</link> or <link xlink:href="61dd433a-ee80-4ac3-87f0-b54708644d93" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">bin data</link> to bin data or adjust the range of values prior to analysis.

trans-unit.source: Choosing an Algorithm
trans-unit.target: Choosing an Algorithm

trans-unit.source: The problem you are trying to solve determines both the choice of data to use in analysis, and the choice of an algorithm.
trans-unit.target: The problem you are trying to solve determines both the choice of data to use in analysis, and the choice of an algorithm.

trans-unit.source: For help in choosing a machine learning algorithm, see <externalLink><linkText>How to choose an algorithm in Azure Machine Learning</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/machine-learning-algorithm-choice/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For help in choosing a machine learning algorithm, see <externalLink><linkText>How to choose an algorithm in Azure Machine Learning</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/machine-learning-algorithm-choice/</linkUri></externalLink>.
